summary: a high morbidity has been reported for diarrhea (calves 35 %; piglets 50 %) and for respiratory diseases (calves 80 %; piglets 40 %) treatment with antimicrobials is often the first-line therapy. several medicinal plants bear a potential for novel treatment strategies. there is a need for further research focused on gastrointestinal and respiratory diseases in calves and piglets.
